folder: Delafield Place & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Delafield Place, north side, between Bard Ave. and Richmond Terrace. Wm. T. Davis states that this was at one time the home of Sanderson Smith, and also of Walter Lambert. The maps from 1874 to 1907 show it to have been the G. Heineken residence, and the 1917 map shows it to have been the R. F. Walser home. The house stands about 80 feet back of the street.

March 26, 1911.

Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.

folder: Bard Avenue & Delafield Place, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bard Ave., north of and adjoining the N.E. corner of Delafield Place. The house on the left is a stable which was part of the G. Heineken estate standing on the north side of the driveway leading into the grounds.

July 5, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
